item.title: Multiple Cases?
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

[code]program New;

procedure NeoAccountMaker;
var
x: integer;
begin
clickMouse(500, 600, True);
wait(1500)
clickMouse(465, 360, True);

x:=random(5)+1;
case x of
1: sendKeys(‘a’);
2: sendKeys(‘s’);
3: sendKeys(‘d’);
4: sendKeys(‘f’);
5: sendKeys(‘g’);
end;

x:=random(5)+1;
case x of
1: sendKeys(‘1’);
2: sendKeys(‘2’);
3: sendKeys(‘3’);
4: sendKeys(‘4’);
5: sendKeys(‘5’);
end;

x:=random(5)+1;
case x of
1: sendKeys(‘z’);
2: sendKeys(‘x’);
3: sendKeys(‘c’);
4: sendKeys(‘v’);
5: sendKeys(‘b’);
end;

x:=random(5)+1;
case x of
1: sendKeys(‘q’);
2: sendKeys(‘w’);
3: sendKeys(‘e’);
4: sendKeys(‘r’);
5: sendKeys(‘t’);
end;

x:=random(5)+1;
case x of
1: sendKeys(‘0’);
2: sendKeys(‘9’);
3: sendKeys(‘8’);
4: sendKeys(‘7’);
5: sendKeys(‘6’);
end;
end;

begin
NeoAccountMaker;
end.[/code]

That should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Cases?
item.dc:creator: @jason2gs jason2gs
item.description:
@jason2gs wrote:

How would I make a script have multiple cases? Like this, below.

program New; procedure NeoAccountMaker; var x: integer; begin clickMouse(500, 600, True); wait(1500) clickMouse(465, 360, True); end; begin x:=random(5)+1; case x of 1: sendKeys('a'); 2: sendKeys('s'); 3: sendKeys('d'); 4: sendKeys('f'); 5: sendKeys('g'); end; begin x:=random(5)+1; case x of 1: sendKeys('1'); 2: sendKeys('2'); 3: sendKeys('3'); 4: sendKeys('4'); 5: sendKeys('5'); end; begin x:=random(5)+1; case x of 1: sendKeys('z'); 2: sendKeys('x'); 3: sendKeys('c'); 4: sendKeys('v'); 5: sendKeys('b'); end; begin x:=random(5)+1; case x of 1: sendKeys('q'); 2: sendKeys('w'); 3: sendKeys('e'); 4: sendKeys('r'); 5: sendKeys('t'); end; begin x:=random(5)+1; case x of 1: sendKeys('0'); 2: sendKeys('9'); 3: sendKeys('8'); 4: sendKeys('7'); 5: sendKeys('6'); end; end.

It keeps on giving me an error message.

Read full topic
